page.title: 13Transport
page.content: The A12 London to Ipswich road runs through the north-western part of the area. The dual carriage-way was constructed in 1967. As there is no alternative route, there is an ever increasing volume of traffic:43000 vehicles per day during 1984, rising to 52000 in August. The predicted qrowth to 2001 is to between 54000 and 65000 vehicles per day. 17% is heavy goods traffic. The accident rate, however, is low compared with other major trunk routes.There are two bus routes in the area, each having about 9 buses a day. The two routes are Hatfield Peverel to Maldon and Witham to Wickham Bishops. The railway line ceased to operate in 1963, and was dismantled in 1968, thus severing the previously well used transport connection with East London.
